title: Modeling a Periodic Context-Tire, Part B

content.question: Part B ​The function <math alttext="h"> <mi>h</mi> </math> can be written in the form <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals a sin open parentheses b open parentheses t plus c close parentheses close parentheses plus d"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mi>a</mi> <mi>sin</mi> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>b</mi> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>c</mi> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </mfenced> <mo>+</mo> <mi>d</mi> </math>. Find values of constants <math alttext="a"> <mi>a</mi> </math>, <math alttext="b"> <mi>b</mi> </math>, <math alttext="b"> <mi>c</mi> </math>, and <math alttext="d"> <mi>d</mi> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
